future_history: The story presents a post-apocalyptic future on Skaro, with a history of conflict between the Thals and the ancestors of the Daleks (Kaleds) dating back half a million years.
untold_adventures: The Doctor's time as a pioneer among his own people
additional_notes: This story establishes the first history of the Daleks, which would be expanded and partly retconned in later stories. It also introduces key elements of TARDIS lore, such as the food machine and fault locator.
bottom_line: A game of two halves. The first four episodes helped launch Doctor Who in the public imagination, and are thoughtful and gripping. The last three comprise a B-movie trek through hideous landscapes in order to defeat the monsters. As a whole, 'The Daleks' is brilliantly directed, full of inventive touches and wonderful set-pieces.
